news.title: A look at OpenAI's tangled web of dealmaking
news.summary: OpenAI's Sam Altman has put himself in the center of the tech universe through a series of mammoth deals. Altman is the founder and CEO of the AI company.

news.title: 5 takeaways from CNBC’s investigation into 'nudify' apps and sites
news.summary: CNBC investigated "nudify" apps and how a group of friends became key figures in the fight against nonconsensual, AI-generated porn.

news.title: A Universal-DreamWorks movie is bringing the winning formula of kids content frenzy to the big screen
news.summary: "Gabby's Dollhouse: The Movie" hits theaters this weekend. Universal and Dreamworks Animation seek to expand the franchise. The movie is the latest installment in the "Dollhouse" series.

news.title: Trump is wielding the power of the state to back critical mineral companies. These are the possible next targets
news.summary: Pentagon deal with MP Materials could provide a blueprint to protect U.S miners against market manipulation by China, executives and analysts say.

news.title: 'Seconds count': Avoiding airplane collisions at airports could come down to cockpit alerts
news.summary: Honeywell is developing a series of new cockpit alerts aimed at preventing collisions at or around airports. Honeywell: New cockpit alerts are aimed at prevent collisions at airports.

news.title: I’m in my 60s and disabled. Should I spend down my assets to qualify for Medicaid?
news.summary: “I was born in a time when the elderly and disabled were hidden away in back bedrooms and institutions,” she says. “I’m proud to be a part of a movement that’s changing the way the world looks at the elderly, the disabled and the sick.”

news.title: I’m 70 and have Alzheimer’s. My son’s girlfriend put $750 worth of lottery tickets on a credit card I gave him. What can I do?
news.summary: “I contacted the credit-card company, but was advised they could not reimburse me for the theft,” she said. “I was advised that they could no longer reimburse me.”

news.title: My wife and I are in our 40s. We have a $600K mortgage and $500K annual income. Can we afford a vacation home?
news.summary: “We plan to work another 20 years and we estimate $3-$4 million in 401(k) savings,” he says.

news.title: ‘I thought she was honest’: My ex-wife hid stocks during our divorce. Can I sue her?
news.summary: “I have contacted her about it, but she refuses to answer my calls,” he says. “I’ve contacted her and she won’t answer.”

news.title: My former mother-in-law left a $1 million estate. Can I sue my ex-husband for a share of it?
news.summary: “My mother-in-law did not leave me anything in her will, but she should have,” he says. “My father-in law did not give me any money.” “She should have left me some money,’ he adds.
